stories.title: Collaborative worldbuilding app with maps, wikis, and whiteboards

stories.text: Hello! I have a few people working for me who regularly need to go "on-site" and carry their laptops with them. Sometimes the location is kind of unfriendly (dust, high temps etc) and also the fact they're carrying their laptop with them all the time means the device is constantly exposed to being hit or dropped, which of course causes damage. I want to start providing them with company laptops soon, and I was thinking to buy them M1 Airs based on the great battery life and fanless design. Even though it's made of aluminum, the Mac isn't really a "rugged" device and I was interested in how I can offer them better protection. Does anyone have any experience with this? Is there something you can recommend?
stories.title: Ask HN: How to make a Mac Air “rugged”?
